description: Pressed from fresh apples, tasty and nutritious.  This is a non-alcoholic beverage, which sometimes confuses foreigners.  It's instead called 'hard cider' when alcohol is involved.
Wait, you can milk almonds?  Not quite, but you can blend them with water!  A dairy-free alternative high in calcium, and rival to soy milk.
Wait, you can milk soybeans?  Not quite, but you can blend them with water!  A dairy-free alternative high in protein, and rival to almond milk.

This serving of coffee has been created using an atomic coffee pot's FULL NUCLEAR brewing cycle.  Every possible microgram of caffeine and flavor has been carefully extracted for your enjoyment, using the power of the atom.
Some wild sarsaparilla root steeped in boiling water.  Energizing.
A healthy beverage made from bee balm steeped in boiling water.  Can be used to reduce negative effects of common cold or flu.
A dense, sweet, creamy sauce, often used in curries.
A traditional south Asian mixed-spice tea with milk.

use_action.description: Can be used to treat insomnia.

description: A healthy beverage made from chamomile flowers steeped in boiling water.  Can be used to treat insomnia.
A chocolate-flavored beverage made of artificial flavoring and milk byproducts.  Shelf stable and vaguely appetizing even when lukewarm.

The morning ritual of the pre-apocalyptic world, created from coffee cherries through a complex process of seed removal, roasting, grinding, and brewing.  Coffee is substantially richer in caffeine than its rival tea.
Homemade not-coffee created from the Kentucky coffeetree, just like the Meskwaki tribe!  Doesn't actually have any caffeine, and is very bitter, but it'll pass in a pinch.
Imitation coffee brewed from Kentucky coffeetree, this drink has no caffeine, no sweetener, and is still unpleasantly bitter even with the added milk.

The morning ritual of the post-apocalyptic world.  Brewed from the Kentucky coffeetree, this drink has no actual caffeine, but serves as a replacement for those who dearly miss the aroma of real coffee.

name: sweetened milk
description: Some milk with sugar added.  Tastes slightly better.

name: sweetened fortified milk
description: Milk enriched with protein powder, it's extra healthy and doesn't taste too bad.  It has sugar added, for those who like it sweeter.
Toasted, ground chicory root steeped in boiling water.  This bitter brew is used as a coffee substitute, though it tastes nothing like coffee.
Things go better with cola.  Sugar water with caffeine added.
It tastes and looks like windshield wiper fluid, but it's loaded to the brim with sugar and caffeine.
A caffeinated, carbonated drink, flavored with vanilla.
Made from real Massachusetts cranberries.  Quite sour, but nutritious.
Mixing cranberry juice and lemon-lime soda works out quite well.
A healthy beverage made from dandelion roots steeped in boiling water.
A healthy beverage made from dandelion and burdock roots steeped in boiling water.  The addition of burdock makes it more nourishing and slightly tastier.

Smooth and rich, this spoon-coating mixture of milk, eggs, and cinnamon sugar is a popular traditional holiday drink.  This type isn't spiked with alcohol, but it is still delicious.  Meant to be stored cold, it will spoil rapidly.
A heavily-caffeinated soft drink.  Popular among those who need to stay up late working.

According to the label, this loathsome-tasting beverage is called ATOMIC POWER THIRST.  Alongside the lengthy health warning, it promises to make the consumer UNCOMFORTABLY ENERGETIC using ELECTROLYTES and THE POWER OF THE ATOM.
//: Check whether Rivtech-Expensive applies to their energy drinks

description: A healthy beverage made from herbs steeped in boiling water.
Also known as hot cocoa, this heated chocolate beverage is perfect for a cold winter day.
A sugary drink from Central America infused with rice, milk, and cinnamon.
A sweet liquid with a vaguely fruity taste.  Having been pasteurized, it will last for a long time.
Freshly-squeezed from real fruit!  Tasty and nutritious.
Freshly-squeezed from real pineapples!  Tasty and nutritious.
An alcohol-free variant of the pina colada cocktail, consisting of pineapple juice and coconut milk.
An alcohol-free variant of the Bloody Mary cocktail; basically tomato juice mixed with some spices.
An alcohol-free mixed drink made from grenadine syrup and lemon-lime soda, lemonade or orange juice.
An alcohol-free mixed drink made from grenadine syrup and cola.
Clear juice obtained by cooking fruit in a large volume of water.
Lemon juice mixed with water and sugar to dull the sourness.  Delicious and refreshing.
Unlike cola this is caffeine free, however it is still carbonated and has plenty of sugar and a lemon-lime taste.
A healthy beverage made from lotus flowers steeped in boiling water.
This semi-bitter chocolate drink made from cocoa, cinnamon, and chilies traces its history to the Maya and Aztecs.  Perfect for a cold winter day.
Coffee syrup or black coffee mixed into milk.  It's been the state drink of Rhode Island since 1993.
Hot tea with cold milk.
Store-bought orange juice.  Refreshing, tasty, and a great source of Vitamin C.
//: most store-bought oj is fortified with calcium.
Calories shouldn't matter since it won't spawn - should only be craftable.
description: Freshly-squeezed from real oranges!  Tasty and nutritious.
Unlike cola this is caffeine free, however it is still carbonated, sweet, and tastes vaguely orange-like.
A fragrant and healthy beverage made from pine needles steeped in boiling water.
A mass-produced grape flavored beverage of artificial origin.  Good for when you want something that tastes like fruit, but still don't care about your health.

name: Mycus juice
description: Freshly-squeezed from the fruit of the Mycus.
Like cola, but without caffeine.  Still not that healthy.
Like cola, but without caffeine.  Still not that healthy, but better than the canned stuff.

A carbonated soft drink which contains quinine, giving it a bitter flavor.  Originally used as a prophylactic against malaria, this modern variant is unsuitable for this purpose as it contains much less quinine and is also sweetened.
Originating in Germany almost a century ago, this mix of cola and orange soda tastes great.
A flavoured drink consisting of a special blend of electrolytes and simple sugars.  It tastes vaguely like fruit with a slight chemical aftertaste.
A healthy beverage made from spurge flowers steeped in boiling water.  Can be used to prevent asthma attacks.

use_action.activation_message: You no longer need to worry about asthma attacks, at least for a while.

description: A basic oral rehydration therapy drink.  It will rehydrate you faster than water, but tastes like bottled sweat.
Water with sugar or honey added.  Tastes okay.
The beverage of gentlemen everywhere, made from applying hot water to oxidized leaves of the tea plant "Camellia sinensis".
A bitter tea made by boiling willow bark in water, used since ancient times as a mild painkiller.
Often regarded as folk medicine in some countries, bark tea tastes awful and tends to dry you out, but can help flush out stomach or other gut bugs.
Contains up to eight vegetables!  Nutritious and tasty.
Water, the stuff of life, necessary for all kinds of crafting, cleaning, and avoiding an agonizing death by dehydration.  You should boil or purify it before using it as drinking water.
Fresh, clean water.  Truly the best thing to quench your thirst.
Fancy mineral water, so fancy it makes you feel fancy just holding it.
Made from applying hot water to leaves of the tea plant "Camellia sinensis".  Green tea has a lighter, fresher taste than black and is traditionally preferred in Asian cultures.
A tasty beverage made with herbs and dried fruit from plants other than the tea plant.  While colloquially called 'tea', technically it's an infusion.

The morning ritual of the pre-apocalyptic world, created from coffee cherries through a complex process of seed removal, roasting, grinding, and brewing.  Coffee is substantially richer in caffeine than its rival tea.  With added sweetener for better taste.
The beverage of gentlemen everywhere, made from applying hot water to leaves of the tea plant "Camellia sinensis".  With added sweetener for a better taste.
Hot tea with cold milk and added sweetener.

Homemade not-coffee created from the Kentucky coffeetree, just like the Meskwaki tribe!  Doesn't actually have any caffeine, but it'll pass in a pinch.  The added sweetener neutralizes the bitterness somewhat.
Coffee syrup mixed into milk.  It's been the state drink of Rhode Island since 1993.  With added sweetener for those who like it even sweeter.
A thick red liquid, made from tomatoes.  Not to everyone's taste, it is a healthy and refreshing drink when chilled.
